ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: An excellent course that introduces a student to Judaism from the pre-exilic era until the Savoriam.
Yes, certainly. The breadth of materials with which we engaged and the methods of interpreting rabbinic literature were aspects which made the course extremely valuable.
I would recommend the course, especially for those without much prior learning in the Old Testament, the second temple period, or rabbinic writings.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It helped fill in many gaps left by previous courses and introduced me to Rabbinic literature in a brief but thorough manner.

My major area of study is not in Judaism/rabbinic writings; however the course provided much useful background not only in thinking about Judaism but also early Christianity. The course also helped me to narrow my preferences for future study.
